2D3F5D98A5C44AD4AD803ADE8284C25F.description: Respond to various types of choral music genres performed by Saskatchewan-based ensembles, considering inclusion and diversity of genres, cultures, genders, eras and styles.

F9E2A1EDCF2B42BE9CA287CABDF53943.description: Describe and justify one’s preferences for various examples of choral styles.

95BC403879A44C608DB925B0406C6244.description: Examine different genres and styles of choral performances.

D5BD9FD7FFF640C2AE2D6E1BA5ADD8C1.description: Consider and explain how music selections are reflections of their place and time.

B2F75F38AB394BC09870D8B612977EF0.description: Use music terminology to describe what is heard.

3B07F2A018734AAFB99B9F23EDB1B916.description: Discuss the sounds, harmonies, rhythmic patterns and text in diverse choral traditions.

038108F75C004046882654CA18F717C4.description: Recognize the elements of music in examples from diverse choral traditions.

59F41124ECEF41968B1CB9D6A2B00CE6.description: Describe, through critical listening, various genres and styles of choral music.

AFF77542824E47CA8C614622601ED568.description: Examine the process of polishing a piece including how to refine a rehearsal (formative) or a performance (summative).

4A32CB8AB9DE4628BCA88BFFE68A8F9F.description: Co-construct goals or criteria for rehearsals and performances.

552375A9F5724EE3ABC92C31B0B918F3.description: Reflect on what went well in rehearsal and performance.

669E50CB4C1F4DE4B65FC665D8A1B2F3.description: Examine individual roles within the ensemble (e.g., personal responsibility, collective, role of conductor).

E609557D6E19448BAF3CD0626F34112F.description: Describe own process for improvement as individual singers and as an ensemble.

B4956DF021D0480AA8D61CCB70B982CE.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian and international artists using critical thinking, research, creativity and collaborative inquiry.

71224271A2D14B2A8DC312EAB4A3C507.description: Identify and discuss some issues regarding posting of music online including possible consequences and permanence of web postings.

C65B48CFE99C4801BBA28DCC8AE31136.description: Investigate and report on current issues and resources connected to copyright law such as “intellectual property”, “open source” and “creative commons”.

E5FA97C70A6C4EABB673C65AA1196242.description: Examine the relationship between copyright and recording and/or posting of music and virtual performances, including online platforms, streaming services and the impact on remuneration for artists.

095128779A084D14ABE2CEDA3785703E.description: Define the term copyright in relation to Canadian and international music laws and assess its impact on a choral class.

EF0D90F90F334035A27A68A0A08AC44D.description: Identify and describe legal and ethical considerations concerning music copyright and performance rights.

9DF7D044D112456F8094750A35DE3D3C.description: Seek opportunities to hear (live and recorded) and participate in choral music performances.

76937AE892824C7595649A1F776247EF.description: Discuss how one becomes a discerning consumer and/or producer of choral music (e.g., criteria for judgement of quality, purchase of recordings or tickets to performances).

A975BB5749844BD7823B817547B363D7.description: Investigate relationships between choral and vocal music and personal wellness including mental health, and identify and discuss associated research.

FE0E7FABA40A4F18B55D08A76FAFCFD2.description: Examine how choral music is used in media and infused in daily life (e.g., to influence consumers via advertising, shopping environments).

F8DC18DFF26C4D6A937964C4A9F4EC92.description: Examine and describe the various roles that singing and choral music play in students’ lives.

6E03F4E8FD584FF3B98711242BB49D54.description: Examine the impact and role of choral music in own life.

4495C80FA601434BAFFFD65231A96DD1.description: Examine sources of inspiration for the songs of First Nations and Métis musicians and composers.

AFF9CA61574B4CA998F40EF54026D429.description: Research the role vocal music plays in Indigenous cultures in Saskatchewan, past and present (e.g., treaty education outcome SI10: Analyze the spirit and intent of treaties and investigate the extent to which they have been fulfilled).

73EBAF94C3AF4648AA7134CF7B5FE362.description: Engage with First Nations and Métis singers to identify regional and individual singing styles.

6DCB7E2E4DB5402C8C4E32D352CD7DE2.description: Discuss various purposes of choral and vocal music (e.g., ceremonial, social, commercial, artistic expression, storytelling).

7236DFF4179A4DF2AEAA4C36C77DA851.description: Examine the role of choral music and Indigenous vocal music in maintaining traditions, reflecting cultural identities and conveying oral histories.

C5C1BB6DDF5449C095E6811118FB888C.description: Research the meaning of cultural appropriation and its relevance to vocal and choral music

C3E28DF0F95F4631898D9C225185E1F9.description: Respond to examples of choirs performing related repertoire.

DCDDB756243A4D819AC2F1DC425AF230.description: Interview a conductor to discuss the conductor’s work and roles (e.g., factors influencing repertoire selection, stylistic features, language considerations).

0827835E45304DD280489AE53088F808.description: Observe and listen to performative practices of various choirs (e.g., cultural performance practices, influence of composer’s place and time on the work).

933E01BA8ACC4C8CA7A610541FECBA4F.description: Discuss the contribution of choral music in building Saskatchewan communities, past and present.

F93228F244C94D0885228E9B69C35D20.description: Connect with community choirs (e.g., Ukrainian, German) to discuss the influence of culture, time or place on repertoire choices and performances.

9E8DA26731014656863CE1754E5C9859.description: Investigate the role of choral music in the context of various cultures, places and eras.

BEF61DDBDE8E4B19AA0AFDF761686952.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical and contemporary contexts and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

08A0E9539EEA4F54A1F8E49A7BFC8DA9.description: Incorporate stylistic features reflective of the socio-cultural contexts of the choral repertoire being studied.

6F6AACC7F7AC4A54B52A62B1E4019397.description: Sing (e.g., warm up, excerpt, repertoire, short folk song) in a minimum of two languages

995E973E9BCF4F189E7B0FC759C027B4.description: Identify and experiment with vocal characteristics and stylistic features that are typical in diverse music genres (e.g., spirituals, jazz, blues, opera).

548D0DCA42164A50B349BA2C79B748D2.description: Identify and experiment with stylistic practices of various vocal and choral music traditions.

6222C46777DD46C2BE061B8D816B6A5E.description: Reflect on individual and group compositions and arrangements, identifying strengths and challenges encountered.

4F87B916DC1545B8B3B8175232A66465.description: Compose, arrange or improvise a short phrase (e.g., create a vocal warm up).

BC5698BA02EE4747B740F3EC41DBEFC5.description: Explore and examine composition and arranging techniques (e.g., What is the composer doing musically in relation to the text? What is a compositional hook?).

1AA2519C2DDA471389EB50F88ED4E44A.description: Experiment with stylistically appropriate group improvisation (e.g., with chords/harmonic background).

441870C92A9641D7A13598FB3180730E.description: Embellish, ornament or improvise on a melody.

6A25A6FF482F4985921FDB1DFEB8E717.description: Take creative risks when creating and refining work.

9C1C8FA896CD4A0FBB321C2F9B70340F.description: Investigate ways that music elements (e.g., tempo, rhythm) can be used to express musical ideas.

DC19D8E370AD4F32B37ED5C43EF5DFC4.description: Experiment with processes for improvising, arranging and composing.

24A469C97B204780B47B610E1B06E2CE.description: Interpret expressive terms and music symbols within the context of the repertoire (e.g., tempo, dynamics, form, style, articulation, graphic symbols).

F9ED357907F7460780FC5581B3BDFB36.description: Demonstrate ability to learn music through aural transmission.

D355D1B2091D4246B4E183CA0A95F033.description: Sight sing a short passage (e.g., at a lower difficulty level than the repertoire studied).

3A9D7D7702AB44CEA2E75EB07855A6F2.description: Demonstrate ability to read, notate, understand and interpret written musical scores and various notation systems.

6D0FC61A36C34F24A4C98818EE0ED772.description: Demonstrate ability to respond to notation systems such as letter names, solfege, scale degrees and aural cues when singing in the context of the repertoire studied.

91FA645BD36B4D67B1C0E383ADFBC23C.description: Demonstrate ability to interpret music using various visual (e.g., standard and/or non-standard notation, written musical scores, graphic score) and aural music systems.

00BE2C71F0C842DCB553AEE01FD1F339.description: Demonstrate ability to respond to the conductor.

BD726B9F5F254A169B929D6A7D0D34FC.description: Incorporate movement in ensemble work (e.g., use movement to experience music concepts) recognizing how singing involves the whole body.

E167588D4CA040CC94F07D309808C504.description: Examine various musical functions in a song (e.g., melody, harmony, bass line).

79BAF4EB05554F0CA80A3D731E65A5F0.description: Apply processes (e.g., focusing on a specific part, experimenting with phrasing, running through from start to finish, working on sections, isolating variables, making group choices), with teacher guidance, for collective practice, rehearsal and performance.

E1BC8A1EC9F448DF9A1D6AF995BF6CB5.description: Demonstrate fluency and growth in vocal techniques and musicality when singing advanced vocal ensemble repertoire.

C3AF1E9038184024AF07734EE40A9011.description: Maintain accurate pitch when singing harmony.

1F58DF45AABB4DCDA218A1265B39C5AD.description: Recognize opportunities for applying interpretation abilities (e.g., inflection, tone, emulating instrumental sounds).

188E52C9ED76462C8231EA103E561B71.description: Demonstrate personal and interpersonal skills necessary for ensemble music making including: etiquette, rehearsal protocols and leadership.

8BD4EC71E0AA47B4A4AC857D3181EE65.description: Demonstrate ensemble skills such as: • adjusting dynamics blending vowels, placing consonants, adjusting vibrato and maintaining own part.

49B18E7F7A614ABAB07529459D0EE851.description: Demonstrate skills (e.g., intonation, pitch breathing, alignment) and practices necessary for ensemble singing.

DBE30E06ED2D4502B8FB06522599EA43.description: Identify factors and apply techniques for maintaining vocal health.

3D652C9949FF46BFBA8E6515771CF608.description: Demonstrate choral blend through vowel unity and understand the role it plays in intonation.

D7F35139388B45F296EFC0491D5CB777.description: Demonstrate and articulate the importance of proper posture and body alignment for singing.

4D273CF68C074BBBAF0308794D61CFEC.description: Discuss and demonstrate the difference between pronunciation (e.g., the act of speaking words correctly), enunciation (e.g., the art of speaking words clearly and concisely) and diction (e.g., the "choice of words" used in writing, speaking or singing).

5785230FD106495D91294230EB7C693A.description: Discuss basic principles of vocal anatomy (e.g., vocal bands/folds, how to produce a sound, sound source, articulators and resonators).

542059EA40A849D39DC8B1BA352DC5A9.description: Demonstrate understanding of fundamentals of tone production (e.g., breath management, supported projection, characteristic tone quality across the ranges, vowel sounds).

96645D325DF94239AD6D971391FD0AAF.description: Recognize, experiment with, and demonstrate different vocal registration (e.g., head voice, chest voice, falsetto, speaking voice).

01B1CA13B88441298CCE17D597CF28DC.description: Identify own range, with teacher guidance, and recognize that voice range may change over time.

838B63BACFF14E999001E593BDD4BE07.description: Examine different ranges (i.e., alto, bass, baritone, tenor, soprano) on a choral score.

885E4D12C7804CD8B2EC9C93220FEE96.description: Discuss the importance of vocal warm ups and regular practise.

37D3528DCBC24E91A040C94BEA80E53C.description: Hear and match pitch and discern accuracy of notes.

885C3507F53F4B4A8FBA0ADCA00AD3C8.description: Describe and demonstrate quality singing in response to given criteria and considering cultural context.

B7DD87430253447FB8BDF2CA31903527.description: Sing with breath support (e.g., practise appropriate breathing technique and recognize how it helps support sound production and vocal health).

B2A12E6B0D054F60AF56B21BAAEEA370.description: Demonstrate basic fundamentals of vocal technique.

84DA9D63BE0F4E9F8A6A16B6AD166E6A.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art.
